One creative way to get essential vitamins and minerals without fruits and vegetables is to incorporate supplements into your diet. You could take multivitamins or specific vitamin and mineral supplements to ensure you are getting the nutrients your body needs.

Another idea is to focus on consuming more plant-based protein sources, such as beans, lentils, and tofu. These foods are often high in vitamins and minerals, and can help fill the nutritional gap left by the absence of fruits and vegetables.

You could also explore alternative sources of vitamins and minerals, such as fortified foods. Many breakfast cereals, oatmeal, and yogurt are fortified with essential nutrients, and can be a convenient way to get your daily dose of vitamins and minerals.

Another option is to focus on consuming more whole grains, such as brown rice, quinoa, and whole wheat bread. These foods are often high in fiber and can help support overall health, while also providing some essential vitamins and minerals.

Finally, you could consider incorporating more nuts and seeds into your diet. These foods are often high in healthy fats, protein, and fiber, and can also be a good source of vitamins and minerals. Examples include almonds, walnuts, chia seeds, and sunflower seeds.
